source_sentence: 佛說造立形像福報經
translation: Foshuo xiuxing zhiqieyi fouxing fouxing jing

source_sentence: 闕譯人名附東晉錄
translation: The names of the missing translators are appended to the Eastern Jin Record

source_sentence: 佛至拘羅懼國，有諸樹園主名拘翼。
translation: When the Buddha arrived in the country of Kukkuṭapāda, there was a tree park owner named Kauṇḍinya.

source_sentence: 時國王名優填，年始十四，聞佛當來，王即勅傍臣左右皆悉嚴駕。
translation: The king of that country, named Udayana, who was fourteen years old when he heard the Buddha's future arrival, ordered his ministers and attendants to all prepare a carriage.

source_sentence: 王行迎佛，遙見世尊心中踴躍，極大歡喜止車下步，罷却左右傍臣侍從及持蓋者，
translation: The king came to greet the Buddha and saw from a distance that the World-honored One was hovering in his chest. Rejoicing greatly, he dismounted from the chariot and stepped down; leaving behind his attendants on his left and right, as well as those who held the canopy over him.

source_sentence: 即前迎趣，便以頭面著地作禮，起復前行，如是至三。
translation: He then went forward to meet him, put his head and face on the ground to pay homage, got up, and proceeded again, thus until he was three times.

source_sentence: 佛言：「來前。」
translation: The Buddha said, Come before me.

source_sentence: 王復前到，以頭面著佛足，起遶三匝，長跪叉手，白佛言：「天上、天下諸天人民無及佛者，
translation: When the king approached again, he put his forehead at the Buddha’s feet, stood up and circumambulated him three times. Kneeling with palms joined together [in respect], he said to the Buddha: There is none among the gods and goddesses in heaven or earth equal to this buddha.

source_sentence: 今佛面目身體行步，光明巍巍好乃如是。
translation: Now the Buddha's face, eyes, bodies, and movements are so brilliant and majestic that they look like this.

source_sentence: 我今視佛無有厭極，佛是天上、天下諸天人民之大師也，佛所慈心哀救甚多。」
translation: Now, I don't tire of looking at the Buddha; he's the great teacher of gods and goddesses in heaven and the world, and his compassionate rescue is so great.

source_sentence: 佛默然不應。
translation: The Buddha remained silent and didn't respond.

source_sentence: 王復白佛言：「人作善者，此之福祐，當何所獲？
translation: Again, the king said to the Buddha, What blessing will be obtained by someone who does good deeds?

source_sentence: 佛去已後，我恐不復見佛。
translation: I'm afraid I won't see the Buddha again after he leaves.

source_sentence: 今欲作佛形像，恭敬承事，得何福報？
translation: What meritorious retribution will be obtained by honoring and serving the buddha image that you wish to make now?

source_sentence: 願佛哀愍，為我說之，我欲聞知。」
translation: May the Buddha have pity on me and explain it for me; I want to hear it.

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告年少王：「汝所問，大善。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the young king, Your questions are very good.

source_sentence: 諦聽吾說，以著心中。」
translation: Listen closely to what I say, and put it in your mind.

source_sentence: 王即稽首言：「受教。」
translation: The king bowed his head and said, Accept the teaching.

source_sentence: 佛告王曰：「若有作佛形像，所得福祐，我今悉當為汝說之。」
translation: The Buddha told the king, If you make an image of the Buddha and attain merit, I will now explain it for you.

source_sentence: 王言：「諾！
translation: The king said, Yes!

source_sentence: 受恩。」
translation: I'll receive your kindness.

source_sentence: 佛言：「天下人民能作佛形像者，其後世世所生之處，眼目淨潔面貌端政，
translation: The Buddha said, “Those who are able to make buddha images in the world will be born in a future existence. They will have eyes and eyes that are pure and clean, and their appearance will be handsome.

source_sentence: 身體手足常好柔濡，生於天上亦復淨潔諸天中勝，眼目面貌甚好無比，
translation: Their bodies, hands, feet, and legs are always soft and gentle. When they are born in the heavens they are also pure and superior to those of the gods. Their eyes and ears have such beautiful features that they cannot compare.

source_sentence: 作佛形像其福如是。
translation: The merit of making an image of the Buddha is like this.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，所生之處無有諸惡身體具足，死後得生第七梵天上，復諸天中形貌端政絕好無比，
translation: Again, the gods in the heavens of Brahmā’s realm will be born wherever they are born. Having died there, they will be reborn in the brahma-heaven (i.e., A Forest of Pearls from the Dharma Garden, Volume I among the Trāyastriṃśa gods). Furthermore, their bodies will be so beautiful and incomp

source_sentence: 為諸天所敬，作佛形像其福如是。
translation: The merit of being honored by the gods and made an image of the Buddha is like this.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，後世常生勢尊貴家，受其氣力與世絕異，在所生處不墮貧家，
translation: “When a buddha image is made, he’ll always be born in a powerful and noble family in the afterlife. Undergoing this power, his energy will be completely different from that of the world. Where he’s born, he won’t fall into the house of poverty.

source_sentence: 作佛形像其福如是。
translation: The merit of making an image of the Buddha is like this.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，後世所生身形殊妙，紫磨金色端政無比，常為眾人所共敬愛，
translation: “Manifesting buddha images, the bodies produced in later ages will be exquisitely shaped. Their purplish-gold color and incomparably handsome, they will always be loved by all people.

source_sentence: 作佛形像其福如是。
translation: The merit of making an image of the Buddha is like this.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，後世生處常在富貴之家，財產珍寶不可稱數，常為父母兄弟宗族之所愛重，
translation: “Manifesting a buddha image, he’ll be born in a wealthy family in the afterlife. His property and treasures won’t be counted, and he’ll always be loved by his parents, brothers, and other clans.

source_sentence: 作佛形像其福如是。
translation: The merit of making an image of the Buddha is like this.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，後世若生閻浮提中，常生帝王公侯賢善之家，作佛形像其福如是。
translation: Making an image of the Buddha is so fortunate that if someone were to be born in Jambudvīpa in a later life, they'd always be born in the emperor's or prince's good family and make an image of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，後世得作帝王特尊勝諸國王，當為諸王之所歸仰，作佛形像其福如是。
translation: Making an image of the Buddha, he'll be able to become a emperor in later generations who is especially honored by the kings of countries, and he'll be revered by the kings, making an image of the Buddha with such merit.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，後世得作遮迦越王，四天下諸王皆臣屬之，作佛形像其福如是。
translation: When he makes an image of the Buddha, he'll be able to become the king of cakravāḍa in a later life, and all the kings of the four continents will follow him, and when he makes an image of the Buddha, his merit is like this.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，後世得作遮迦越王，飛行天上復下自恣，在所施為無所不至，
translation: In a later life, he'll be able to form an image of the Buddha and become the cakravartin king. He'll fly up and down in heaven and perform his own rituals, and there'll be nothing he doesn't attain where he gives.

source_sentence: 作佛形像其福如是。
translation: The merit of making an image of the Buddha is like this.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，後世生於第七梵天，壽一劫餘，智慧尊勝無上無能及者，
translation: “Manifesting buddha images, he was born in the seventh Brahma heaven in a later life. His life span was more than one cosmic age and his wisdom preeminent and unsurpassed that of all wise beings.

source_sentence: 作佛形像其福如是。
translation: The merit of making an image of the Buddha is like this.

source_sentence: 於梵天壽盡當復來下，生於孝順有道法家，作佛形像其福如是。
translation: At the end of his life in Brahmā Heaven, he'll come back down again, be born in a filial home of the Way and Dharma, and become an image of the Buddha. Such is his merit.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，後所生處常為父母之所愛重，壽終復得生於天上，作佛形像其福如是。
translation: Making an image of the Buddha is always loved by their parents where they're born, and when their life ends, they'll be reborn in heaven again, making an image of the Buddha will bring such merit.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，死後不復墮三惡道，當自守意常欲求佛。
translation: Making an image of the Buddha, they won't fall into the three bad destinies again after death, but they should guard their own minds and always want to seek the Buddha.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，後世生處尊重於經，意欲常持雜好香華、雜好繒綵、燈火光明，
translation: “Manifesting a buddha image, he venerates the scriptures in his native land in later lifetimes and wishes to always carry fine fragrant flowers, fine silk ribbons, light from a candle-light lamp.

source_sentence: 諸天下中名好珍寶奉上佛塔，後無數劫，會當得佛涅槃之道。
translation: Countless eons from now I shall attain the nirvana of buddhahood.

source_sentence: 人有出意持妙珍寶、所愛重物奉上佛者，非餘凡人，皆是前世作佛形像者、習菩薩道者，
translation: Those who go out of their minds to offer the marvelous treasures and beloved things to the Buddha are no different from ordinary people, all those who made buddha images in former lives and practiced the bodhisattva path.

source_sentence: 作佛形像其福如是。
translation: The merit of making an image of the Buddha is like this.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，其福無量，無窮盡時不可稱數，如是四天下江河海水尚可升量，
translation: “Manifestly immeasurable are the merits of those who make buddha images, whose merits cannot be measured or counted even at the end of time. The water in the seas and rivers of the four quarters of the earth can still be measured;

source_sentence: 作佛形像其福甚多，多四天下江河海水過出十倍，後世所生常護佛道。
translation: Making an image of the Buddha is very blessed because it produces more than ten times as many merits as the water in the four continents' rivers and seas, and being born in later generations always protects the Buddha Way.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，譬如天雨，人有好舍無所憂畏。
translation: Making an image of the Buddha is like a heavenly rain, when people have a nice dwelling and don't worry or fear.

source_sentence: 「作佛形像，死後不復入於地獄、畜生、餓鬼諸惡道中。
translation: Making an image of the Buddha, they won't go back into hell, animals, hungry ghosts, or other bad destinies after death.

source_sentence: 其有眾生見佛形像生恭敬心，叉手自歸佛塔舍利者，死後百劫不復入於地獄、畜生、餓鬼道中。
translation: If there are sentient beings who see the Buddha's images and give rise to respect, salute him with palms joined at the Buddha's stūpa and relics, they won't again enter hell, the animal kingdom, or the hungry ghost realm for a hundred eons after death.

source_sentence: 死即生天，天上壽終，復生世間勢富之家，如是受福不可稱數，會當得佛涅槃之道。」
translation: When they die, they'll be born in heaven, and when their life span in heaven ends, they'll again be born in the world into a wealthy family, thus receiving merit that can't be measured, and they'll attain the Buddha's path of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 佛告優填王：「人作善者作佛形像，其福祐功德如是，終不唐苦。」
translation: The Buddha told King Udayana, A person who does good deeds creates an image of the Buddha, and their fortune and merit are like this, so they won't suffer in vain.

source_sentence: 「佛者大聖人，　　為眾生說法，
translation: “Buddha is a great sage who teaches the Dharma for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 拘深瞿師園，　　優填叉手問，
translation: Kauṣṭhila's Park, Udayana asked with palms joined.

source_sentence: 聞梵音審諦，　　不動百福成，
translation: Hearing the sound of Brahma’s voice, they deliberate truth; Without moving a hundred blessednesses are attained.

source_sentence: 作佛形像者，　　得何等福報？」
translation: What's the meritorious reward for someone who makes an image of the Buddha?

source_sentence: 「王諦聽吾說，　　福地恢上土，
translation: The king listened attentively to my exhortation, And the field of blessings extended to the highest land.

source_sentence: 福德無過者，　　作佛形像報。
translation: The one whose virtue is without error Makes a buddha image as retribution.

source_sentence: 恒生大富家，　　尊貴無極珍，
translation: They'll always be born in a house of great wealth, Most noble and unexcelled treasure.

source_sentence: 眷屬常恭敬，　　作佛形像報。
translation: Their retinues always honored them and made images of the Buddha as their reward.

source_sentence: 世世身無患，　　常得天眼報，
translation: The body of all beings is not afflicted, Always receiving the retribution of divine vision.

source_sentence: 無比紺青色，　　作佛形像報。
translation: It's incomparable, dark blue in color, and made to resemble the Buddha's form as a reward.

source_sentence: 父母見歡忻，　　端政威德重，
translation: His parents were delighted to see him. Their manner was dignified and the prestige of their virtue high.

source_sentence: 愛樂終無厭，　　作佛形像報。
translation: Their cravings and pleasures are never disillusioned, which is the result of making buddha images.

source_sentence: 金色身焰光，　　猶妙師子像，
translation: His golden-colored body was shining like a beautiful lion image.

source_sentence: 眾生見歡喜，　　作佛形像報。
translation: When sentient beings see it, they rejoice and create the Buddha’s images as their reward.

source_sentence: 閻浮提大姓，　　剎利婆羅門，
translation: The great family of Jambudvīpa is a kṣatriya- brāhmaṇa.

source_sentence: 福人於中生，　　作佛形像報。
translation: A blessed person will be born there And become a buddha in the form of retribution.

source_sentence: 不生邊地國，　　不盲不醜陋，
translation: They won’t be born in a marginal land or country, Being neither blind nor ugly.

source_sentence: 六情常完具，　　作佛形像報。
translation: The six emotions are always complete, and it's the reward of making buddha images.

source_sentence: 臨終識宿命，　　見佛在其前，
translation: At the end of his life, conscious of past lives, he saw the Buddha before him.

source_sentence: 不覺死時苦，　　作佛形像報。
translation: They don't feel pain at the time of death and create the Buddha's form as a reward.

source_sentence: 作大名聞王，　　金輪飛行帝，
translation: He becomes the great renowned king of hearers, Golden-wheeled flying emperor.

source_sentence: 典主四天下，　　作佛形像報。
translation: The treasury councilor of the four continents Produced buddha images as rewards.

source_sentence: 作釋天名因，　　神足典第二，
translation: He made the explanation of the names and causes of the gods, which are the second in the supernormal abilities scripture.

source_sentence: 三十三天奉，　　作佛形像報。
translation: The thirty-three gods offered the image of the Buddha as their reward.

source_sentence: 此過出欲界，　　作梵梵天王，
translation: This is a transgression to leave the realm of desire and become king of Brahmā.

source_sentence: 迦夷眾梵恭，　　作佛形像報。
translation: Kāśyapa and the other Brahmā gods made buddha images as retribution.

source_sentence: 受福正如是，　　若能刻畵作，
translation: Such is the merit that you receive. If you can carve and paint it,

source_sentence: 天地尚可稱，　　此福不可量。
translation: Heaven and earth can still be praised, but this merit is immeasurable.

source_sentence: 是故供養佛，　　華香香汁塗，
translation: That’s why they make offerings to the Buddha, Covered with flowers, fragrant juice, and ointments.

source_sentence: 供養大士者，　　得漏盡無為。」
translation: Those who make offerings to the great person will attain the cessation of contaminants and nothingness.

source_sentence: 爾時，優填王以偈讚佛：爾時，世尊說偈答曰：佛說經竟，王大歡喜，
translation: Then King Udayana praised the Buddha in verse: At that moment, the World-Honored One answered in verse: The king was greatly delighted when the Buddha finished his discourse.

source_sentence: 即起前以頭面著佛足而起，比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，及其五百傍臣左右，
translation: He rose up, put his forehead at the Buddha’s feet, and stood up. The bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, brāhmaṇas, laymen, and laywomen, together with their five hundred attendants, greeted him as follows:

source_sentence: 皆起歡喜為佛作禮，後皆往生阿彌陀佛國，作大菩薩最尊第一。
translation: They all rejoiced and bowed to the Buddha, and then they were all reborn in the land of Amitâbha Buddha as the most honored among great bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 優填王聞其所說，歡喜受解，即得須陀洹道。
translation: Upon hearing what he said, King Udayana was delighted and accepted his understanding, and attained the path of stream entry.

source_sentence: 佛說造立形像福報經
translation: Foshuo xiuxing zhiqieyi fouxing fouxing jing
